Dating: TUTHMOSIS IV/MENKHEPERURE (not after); 18TH DYNASTY; AMENHOTEP II/AMENOPHIS II/AAKHEPERURE (not before)
Name: Servants with funerary equipment
Description: This scene from a Theban tomb chapel depicts sections of the furnishing of the tomb with its equipment. The servants in this fragment are carrying a chest with toilet implements consisting of a mirror and unguent containers, which are depicted above it. In addition, there is a light hunting chariot with lateral quivers. The two men have closely cropped hair and they are bare-chested.
